get.description: Print a list of reports and bundle them in a zip

options.description: enable cors by returning correct headers

get.description:
Fetches all reports that match the parameters provided by the client.

⚠ When updating this route, also consider https://pericles.applidium.com/projects/52/routes/1194

post.description:
Creates a new report which will follow the classic workflow.

If you want to create a new report with a direct supplier return, please use https://pericles.applidium.com/projects/52/routes/1184

delete.description:
This route can be used only by roles carrying this kind :
* `LECTEUR_H`;
* `ANIMATEUR_QUALITE`.

You may use query param with id (ie : ?id=id1&id2) to specify which reports you are willing to delete.

options.description: enable cors by returning correct headers

get.description:
Aims at getting all products that match with the provided `batch_number`
or `delivery_number`. This route is also able to get all the information about a single product if a `SKU` is provided.

get.description: Fetches all defects present in the database

post.description:
This route is responsible to persist images in the server.

Input: The binary to persist.

post.description: Update the report and change its status to `reviewed`.

options.description: enable cors by returning correct headers

post.description:
Creates a new report with :
* `status` = `reviewed`
* `orientation` = `direct_supplier_return`

So the created report will not pass through the classic workflow but directly be reviewed.

get.description:
Triggered on start up of the iPad app and web application, aims at fetching all stable information defined in the Config object.

If the user is not registered in database, returns a 401. Otherwise, returns the config.
Same request for both web app and mobile app, so app-specific control must be managed in the specific app.

profile_picture_URL.description: URL where the user's profile picture can be fetched

atlas_id.description: Contains the ADFS identifier used by the employee when signing in through Amazon Cognito

site.description: Describes where the user works. Is null if the user has a role of Fournisseur

one_letter_code.description: 1-letter code used in order to label the reports

is_bobigny.description: If set to true, subsidiary is checked at Bobigny, otherwise at Deret's premises in Saran

picture_URL.description: Picture that is used as a reference when the user wants to locate the defect.

picture_without_drawing_URL.description: Contains all URLs of pictures without drawing, picture are at their initial size. Used for future purposes (detect defects thanks to AI)

picture_part_URL.description: Contains the picture (orange dot touched by the user on the schematic representation of the item).

is_visible.description: Sets visibility in the photo gallery

reviewed_at.description: Date when the reviewer validated the review (`POST /report/:id/review`)

defect.description: Can be null as process configured says : 1. create report 2. create defects linked to report.

report_code.description: Matches the pattern used by Hermès in order to label the report : letter matching the subsidiary-XX (2 digits for the year)-XXXX(Number of the report for the given year, for the given subsidiary)

is_archived.description: true if user that declared the defect transferred the report to "Archive", false otherwise.

comment.description: Comment is left by the report's reviewer, which is `LECTEUR_H` or `ANIMATEUR_QUALITE`. Consult the Role resource webpage for further details

name.description: Complete name of the orientation in English
